addressleaf.section: To the right honorable my very singular good Lord the L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England

28 Maij
1593
M
r
Bodeley. to my L.
Count Charles Mannsfeild
retorned out of
Fraunce
The waters about
Gertrur
e
bergh
overflowen.

page.lettertext:
fol.114r
May it please yo
r
good L. I had no sooner
sealed my former unto yo
w
, but we had l
re
s
from divers places,
at
e Co. Charles Mansfild is
returned out of France, and commeth w
t
speede
to
e aide of his father. And besides it is
written from
e ca mpe unto us,
at by reason of
a Northwest winde, w
ch
hath blowen very harde
for these 3 daies together,
e waters about
Gertrudenbergh have overflowen o
r
approches,
and done us more hindrance, then can be reco-
vered in 10 or 12 daies.
W
ch
I thought very
fitte to adde to my former l
re
, and so I take
my humble leave. Fr
o
e Hage. May 28
1593.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley.
I should certifie yo
r
L. in w
at
maner this
Councel doth proceede w
t
S
r
Thomas Morgan
,
but sith his mater is not ended, and it would
be very tedious, to discourse it at full, I have
thought it most expedient, to reserve it till
my c
o
ming, to declare it by worde of mouth.
